form.PN:
4. pomen in glagol izgovarjamo
/kl*@*Uz/
, pridevnik ali prislov pa
/kl*@*Us/
.

sense.def:
To close a door, window, or lid
pomeni premakniti vrata, okno ali pokrov tako, da pokrije odprtino ali vrzel in zato ta ni več odprta.

seg.quote: He opened the door and closed it behind him.
It took a bit of pressure to make the lid close.
I fell asleep with my window closed tight.
He was sitting with closed eyes.

sense.def:
Kadar neki kraj
closes
, ga ljudje ne morejo uporabljati, ali pa se tam konča vse delo.

seg.quote: Many libraries close on Saturdays at 1 p.m.
Shotton Steelworks was closed with the loss of nearly 8,000 jobs.
It was Sunday and the garage was closed.

sense.def:
To close an event or matter
pomeni končati dogodek ali zadevo.

seg.quote: He spoke as though he wanted to close the conversation.

sense.def:
The close of a period of time or an activity
je konec obdobja ali dejavnosti;

seg.quote: ...towards the close of the day.
The war in Europe drew to a close.

sense.def:
To close on someone
pomeni približati se čloeveku, ki ga zasledujemo.

seg.quote: The boat was about 200 yards away from us but closing fast.

sense.def:
Kadar je nekaj
close to something else
, je blizu nečesa drugega.

seg.quote: Their two heads were close together.
I got close enough to see what the trouble was.
He moved a bit closer.
The crowd moved in more closely around him.

sense.def:
Ljudje, ki so
close
, dobro poznajo drug drugega in se imajo zelo radi.

seg.quote: They felt very close to each other.
...my closest friends.
They felt a new closeness in relationships with their friends.

sense.def:
One's close relatives
so najbolj neposredni družinski člani, na primer starši, bratje ali sestre.

Stik ali sodelovanje, ki je
close
, je tisti, pri katerem nekoga zelo pogosto vidimo ali imamo stike z njim.

seg.quote: My sons have maintained extremely close ties with a college friend.
Every doctor works closely with the Child Health Service.

sense.def:
Če je med dvema predmetoma
a close link or resemblance
, sta zelo povezana ali podobna.

seg.quote: ...the close link between love and fear.
She regarded Lomax with something that was close to fear.
Status was closely linked with wealth.
...a creature that closely resembles a newt.

sense.def:
Preverjanje ali opazovanje, ki je
close
, je pazljivo in natančno.

seg.quote: These events deserve closer examination.
He studied the photographs very closely.

sense.def:
Kadar so tekma ali volitve
close
, je zmaga dosežena ali izgubljena za las.

seg.quote: The vote was close.

sense.def:
Kadar je neki dogodek
close
, ali kadar je človek
close to an event
, se bo verjetno kmalu zgodil.

seg.quote: An agreement seems close.
The Government several times came close to defeat.
She was close to tears.

sense.def:
Kar je
close by
ali
close at hand
, je v naši bližini.

seg.quote: There was a small lamp on the table close by.

sense.def:
Če nekaj pogledamo
close up
ali
close to
, pogledamo takrat, ko smo tistemu zelo blizu.

seg.quote: It was my first glimpse of him close to.

sense.def:
Če je nekaj
close to a particular amount or distance
ali
close on a particular amount or distance
, je malo manjše od tiste količine ali razdalje.

seg.quote: ...a bill of close to £8,000.
The pile of wood was close on ten feet in height.

sense.def:
Kadar je neki dogodek
a close shave
,
a close thing
, ali
a close call
, bi se pri tem kmalu zgodila nesreča ali katastrofa.

seg.quote: It was a very close shave. The car only just missed me.

sense.def:
Kadar tovarna ali podjetje
closes down
, se tam ustavi vse delo ali dejavnost, navadno za zmeraj.

seg.quote: The magazine was forced to close down.
The mines had been closed down.

sense.def:
Kadar ljudje
close in on a person or place
, pridejo bliže neki osebi ali kraju in ga postopoma obkolijo.

seg.quote: As the enemy closed in, the resistance of the villagers shrank to nothing.
